name: Anti-Defamation League
memberOrga: ADL is not a membership organization.
goal:
Since 1913, the Anti-Defamation League has worked "to stop the defamation of the Jewish people, and to secure justice and fair treatment to all." Today, ADL is the premier civil rights/human relations organization of the United States. We fight threats to our very democracy, including cyberhate, bullying, bias in schools and in the criminal justice system, terrorism, hate crimes, coercion of religious minorities, and contempt for anyone who is different.

A nonprofit, nonpartisan organization with supporters and partners throughout the United States and around the world, ADL is rooted in Jewish values. We speak up for those whose voices are not always heard. Our network of more than two dozen regional offices nationwide and an office in Jerusalem are on the ground, organizing and galvanizing grassroots support around the most pressing issues of the day.
interests: Education, External Relations, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Information Society, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Research and Technology
euInitiatives: Anti-Semitism, hate crime, hate speech, online hate speech, extremism, law enforcement training, anti-bias education, religious freedom, anti-discrimination.
